intro: Plumbago pulchella, commonly known as the sweet flag or blue mist shrub, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has aromatic leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Plumbago pulchella is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
